channel.title: Trouble with a tut[PI - Client Sided]
channel.description:
I'm using this tutorial http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/snippets/470192-pi-tab-reply.html on this base http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,640976.0.html and getting this compiling error: [URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/33/hko3.png/][IMG]http://img33.imageshack.us/img33/7291/hko3.png[/img][/URL]
I know this means I have to declare the variable, but I'm just confused as to where, why, and how. The tutorial worked for everyone else, and I looked through my server archive, found a very similar method of doing this, tried to figure out what was wrong, so I looked for how many "chatTypes" there were in the client classes of both server's clients, and it had the same amount, so I'm very confused. anyone got any ideas?

item.title: Trouble with a tut[PI - Client Sided]
item.dc:creator: @PI_Developer PI_Developer
item.description:
@PI_Developer wrote:

I got it!
For some reason my client’s chatType variable was actually chattype
And other methods are using that variable, so I just had to change the letter to lowercase in the pmtabtoreply method
Thanks The7thSanctum

Read full topic
item.source: Trouble with a tut[PI - Client Sided]

item.title: Trouble with a tut[PI - Client Sided]
item.dc:creator: @The7thSanctum The7thSanctum
item.description:
@The7thSanctum wrote:

Do you have:

and

If you don’t add the first under:
“public client() {”

And the second after:
“private static int anInt940;” If you don’t have this, just add it at the bottom where all of the private ints, sprites etc are all declared.

Read full topic
